citations.narrative:
On May 30, 2025, one male red fox “Hermes” required surgery to remove a piece of hard rubber that had caused an
intestinal blockage. The facility provided veterinary care in a timely manner and, to date, the fox is recovering well. While
the facility states they don’t recognize the foreign material and they don’t know where the fox obtained it, the facility does
provide rubber toys and tunnels to their foxes for enrichment.
Inappropriate handling of animals, including providing unsuitable enrichment to the animals, can result in injury and death.
All animals must be handled in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating excessive cooling, behavioral stress,
physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.

The facility is not following the program of veterinary care (PVC) for vaccinations of their dogs. The PVC instructs that
dogs will be vaccinated against leptospirosis and Lyme disease annually, among other vaccines. At the time of the
inspection, one of the two adult dogs currently housed at the facility had not received his annual leptospirosis and Lyme
disease vaccines as required by the PVC. The licensee corrected the issue immediately after the inspection.
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the PVC does not ensure the dogs are receiving
appropriate protection against diseases such as distemper, parvo, leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and
discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the
program of veterinary care to protect the dogs from contagious diseases.
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class "B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by July 29, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On May 30, 2025, one male red fox “Hermes” required surgery to remove a piece of hard rubber that had caused an 
intestinal blockage. The facility provided veterinary care in a timely manner and, to date, the fox is recovering well. While 
the facility states they don’t recognize the foreign material and they don’t know where the fox obtained it, the facility does 
provide rubber toys and tunnels to their foxes for enrichment.  
 
Inappropriate handling of animals, including providing unsuitable enrichment to the animals, can result in injury and death. 
All animals must be handled in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating excessive cooling, behavioral stress, 
physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care (PVC) for vaccinations of their dogs. The PVC instructs that 
dogs will be vaccinated against leptospirosis and Lyme disease annually, among other vaccines. At the time of the 
inspection, one of the two adult dogs currently housed at the facility had not received his annual leptospirosis and Lyme 
disease vaccines as required by the PVC. The licensee corrected the issue immediately after the inspection.  
 
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the PVC does not ensure the dogs are receiving 
appropriate protection against diseases such as distemper, parvo, leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and 
discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the 
program of veterinary care to protect the dogs from contagious diseases. 
 
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class "B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by July 29, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.

Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
